description: Render template definitions stored EXTERNAL TO CODE. These define HOW to present each step type - phases, input modes, prompts, panel formatting. They accept clue step template data as input.

standard_definition.description: Generic presentation logic for definition identification steps

intro.title: Find the Definition
intro.text:
Every standard cryptic clue has a 'straight' definition — a normal dictionary meaning of the answer.

Key insight: The definition is ALWAYS at the very start OR the very end of the clue. Never in the middle!
intro.example: Ignore the misleading surface story. Focus on the start and end — which phrase could define a word?

panel.title: FIND THE DEFINITION
panel.instruction: Tap the definition words. Remember: it's always at the start or end of the clue.

onWrong.message: Hint: The definition is always at the very start OR very end — never in the middle.

panel.title: DEFINITION FOUND: {definition_text}
panel.instruction: Good! The definition, '{definition_text}', is at the {position} of the clue.
